headline: Essential Security Checks for Modern Apps

digest_items.title: Implement security monitoring
digest_items.why: Real-time monitoring detects attacks and anomalies early
digest_items.fix: Use SIEM tools and set up alerts for suspicious activities

digest_items.title: Review cloud storage permissions
digest_items.why: Misconfigured S3 buckets and storage accounts lead to data leaks
digest_items.fix: Ensure buckets are private and use IAM policies for access control

digest_items.title: Verify SPF records are configured
digest_items.why: SPF records prevent email spoofing by specifying which servers can send email for your domain
digest_items.fix: Add a TXT record: 'v=spf1 include:_spf.google.com ~all' (adjust for your mail provider)

digest_items.title: Implement Content Security Policy
digest_items.why: CSP headers prevent XSS attacks by controlling which resources can load

digest_items.title: Use subresource integrity (SRI)
digest_items.why: SRI prevents compromised CDN resources from executing malicious code
digest_items.fix: Add integrity attribute to script and link tags loading external resources

digest_items.title: Use secure cookie flags
digest_items.why: Insecure cookies can be stolen via XSS or transmitted over HTTP
digest_items.fix: Set HttpOnly, Secure, and SameSite flags on all cookies

digest_items.title: Review third-party vendor access
digest_items.why: Excessive vendor permissions increase attack surface and compliance risk
digest_items.fix: Audit vendor access quarterly and apply principle of least privilege
